title: Create miscellaneous support ticket on anyone's account through support@hackerone.com email

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
I hope you're well,
Hackerone recently changed from Zendesk to Freshdesk , that introduced this vulnerability , This asset is not in scope but the reason I'm reporting this because of the severity of this vulnerability as this can cause high impact on integrity of support desk.

**Description:**
This vulnerability is similar to my previous finding [on Dropbox program](https://infosecwriteups.com/mail-server-misconfiguration-leads-to-sending-a-fax-from-anyones-account-on-hellofax-dropbox-bbp-aab3d97ab4e7?source=user_profile---------0----------------------------]) , So when we create a support ticket by sending email to support@hackerone.com then it creates a support ticket on Hackerone Support portal on Victim's support center account , I found that we can create support ticket on anyone's  by sending a fake email to support@hackerone.com , by putting victim's email in `FROM` field. This would create a support ticket on victim's account , attacker can use this to create miscellaneous tickets on anyone's account or they can create ticket on behalf of **Hackerone** staff. You can check the ticket (441828) , I created this ticket by sending a fake email.
We can use any fake emailer service for e.g https://emkei.cz/

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to https://emkei.cz/
2. Put victim's email in `From E-mail:	` field and support@hackerone.com in `To:` field
3. Enter anything in name , content , subject and click Send

██████

* Now a ticket would be created on behalf of victim

## Impact

* Using this bug an attacker can create miscellaneous tickets on behalf of victim or create unnecessary noise on victim's support desk account
* Attacker can create internal ticket on behalf of HackerOne employees

Best Regards
**Sayaan Alam**

activities.message:
Hi @sayaanalam,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @sayaanalam,
I hope you are doing well.

Could you please help us with a PoC which shows you were able to raise a ticket on behalf of other test user?

I would love to take another look at your report once you have provided additional information supporting your issue.

Cheers,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron ,

Sure , Just give me few mins , i'm making a video PoC for you

Thanks

Here the video PoC attached @h1_analyst_aaron , I hope it's clear now
██████

Best regards
@sayaanalam
Sure @h1_analyst_aaron , I'm waiting :)

Hi @sayaanalam,
I hope you are doing well.

I had discussion with the HackerOne team internally and team asked us to close this report and any future reports for this asset(support.hackerone.com) as out-of-scope.
 
Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find. 

Best Regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron ,

This report has good impact and it is affecting hackerone users , so I hope team should consider it

Thanks

Hi @sayaanalam,

Thank you for your submission! Unfortunately, this particular issue you reported is explicitly out of scope as outlined in the [Policy Page](https://hackerone.com/security/policy_scopes):  

> - This asset is hosted by Freshdesk (as of 2023-04-28) - OOS
 
Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find. 

Best Regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Another hacker has reported this recently which has caused us to reconsider, and as a result we've made a change to our settings. 

Whilst the asset is out of scope it looks like you're the first person to report this, could you perform a re-test to see if the issue has been fixed?

I will copy-paste my answer to the other hacker of report #2082680 here --

>We will talk among the team here to see what's best, there are a few reports this is technically a duplicate of but were closed as informative as we mark support.hackerone.com as out-of-scope, because it's hosted on a third party, but "misconfiguration of a managed service" is still a valid case IMO especially since it allows for impact like this. 
>
>In short:
>- We changed our configuration to mitigate this attack in Freshdesk
>- We deactivated the account you registered (of which the account status is unconfirmed)
>- We'll take the product feedback into account for this in account as well, and it's been raised with relevant product managers.
>
>We'll discuss within the engineering team what makes sense here (if there is a bounty and/or bonus; if bounty/bonus goes to the first reporter, a split, fully to you, etc.) - this is a little bit of uncharted territory for me at the moment.

I'm still able to reproduce the vulnerability , I was able to create the ticket #464813 using same method

Thanks

Thanks for the quick response!

That's interesting! I will come back to you on that. I really thought it was fixed as neither I nor the other hacker were able to reproduce. We will investigate more thoroughly.

Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for your response , Here are my thoughts on severity :-

* As application is managed service by Hackerone and this is a sensitive and very important application hackerone as it operates most of external operations and hacker communication , 
* So an attacker can easily target any internal (hackerone staff) / customer / or hackerone to **poision their support desk account with spam ticket , these tickets can be in 100s or 1000s which will make support panel almost unavailable for the victim** as they won't be able to track and find important ticket among thousands of spam tickets created by attacker , So it creates an availability impact as well.

Regarding the bounty - As I am the first reporter of the vulnerability and there is a big difference between both reports so I believe I deserver the full bounty/vulnerability for this vulnerability, there should not be any splitting as I have also never seen cases like this ,  you can choose to award bonus to other researcher but this report should be paid full what I deserve IMO!!!

Kind regards
Sayaan Alam

Hi, I'm unable to reproduce your retest results.

I tried testing this using your steps as described and cannot reproduce, rather, I get this:

```
H1 Support 15:48 (0 minutes ago)
to me

Hi [REDACTED],

As of May 15, 2023, this email no longer accepts new requests. To contact us, please use our HackerOne Support Portal, https://support.hackerone.com/support/home.

Have a great day!
HackerOne
```

Can you explain which steps you've taken to reproduce this issue successfully?

Hi @zerotea ,

Yes you will receive this email , but upon logging into support.hackerone.com , you will se that the ticket would be created.

Best regards 
Sayaan A.
You're right, I was able to reproduce.
Revert report state to new from retesting
I will talk with the internal team on how we will handle this further.

Sure @zerotea , I’d be waiting for further updates 

Kind regards 
Sayaan A.

additional_data.old_title: Create miscellaneous support ticket on anyone's account
additional_data.new_title: Create miscellaneous support ticket on anyone's account through support@hackerone.com email

activities.message:
Hi @zerotea ,

I have just found that the other report #2082680 which is duplicate of this one , is rewarded, resolved and disclosed today , While I as original reporter is still waiting for updates and bounty here on this report, Can you please update what is happening around? Never saw something like this 

Kind regards
Sayaan A.

Hi,

That report was not a duplicate, there's a distinct difference (and that is why this retest failed):

- Your report talks about contacting support@hackerone.com,
- Theirs talks about submitting via the support portal.

They have been awarded and disclosed already since that particular issue has been mitigated already, whereas this one is still pending confirmation by the IT team as it is not something we can easily change in Freshdesk software. When IT confirms the root cause of the issue as valid; I can award, retest, resolve, & disclose.

In other words: It's taking slightly more time for the IT team to confirm this bug (and I was also slower in notifying them, as we discovered the difference between the reports at a later stage - when this retest was still reproducible) rather than it took for the Support team to confirm the other bug, which is why their report was able to be handled faster. But rest assured it is being looked into.

Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for the clarification and correcting me , I’d be waiting for further updates 

Kind regards 
Sayaan A.

We reached consensus amongst all relevant owners on the best fix, thank you for reporting and sorry it took a while :)

Will prompt for a re-test when we have fixed the problem.

Hi @zerotea ,

Thanks for the bounty, but I believe this should lie under the bounty of Medium category, I hope it could be reconsidered for a standard payout?

Kind regards 
Sayaan A.

Hi,

We don't have a clear guidance on how or what we pay for this particular asset, it's "officially" listed out of scope and does not have a bounty table associated with it, within the team we agreed that this and some similar reports (like #2068830, #2082680, #2085260 -- aka "assets not in scope" or "assets out of scope but valid vulns") would get a $1000 bonus (in these cases, as they were all mediums by CVSS) for now until we have a clearer process for what's the bounty table for those particular assets. Suffice to say we did consider this a medium severity problem internally.

Using the current status of the report (asset = support.hackerone.com), I cannot provide a standard payout as it has no bounty table nor is considered out of scope, which is product feedback we've passed on as result of #2082680 and #2085260.

Hi @zerotea ,

Sorry to ping you here about another report, I just came across an old report (#1428456) I submitted to the HackerOne program which is very similar to this one and has the same or higher impact. **Here an attacker was able to submit report on behalf of other hackers.**

I thought you might be interested to look into it , that is also an interesting isssue.

Kind Regards
Sayaan A.
Hey @sayaanalam, a short update: We've identified a decent fix, once that is implemented we will ask you for a retest.

Hi @zerotea ,

Sure , I'd be waiting and I hope you have had a look at (#1428456) , that's an interesting issue and you'd love it

Thanks

We've gotten word that we've adjusted the automation to resolve this problem, could you verify?

Internally, the automation marked the tickets as resolved already, now they're also instantly deleted.
I can't take a look at #1428456, if you think it needs another look I recommend using mediation or asking support (since it's quite old)

Hi ,

The bug on support panel side is fixed , but the victim user is still receiving email from support@hackerone.com

Thanks

Hi, receiving the email is fine - the ticket is immediately deleted (it's a transaction process we cannot stop: so it DOES create the ticket, but then automation immediately resolves & deletes it, nobody ever gets to see it internally).

It's a bit of an odd behaviour, but a limitation of the 3rd party software we're using (maybe in combination with some of our config) it seems like
Revert report state to triaged from retesting

Hi @zerotea ,

I have tried mediation but that isn't working because it's an old report , It's more interesting and relevant to how this vulnerability was , I strongly recomment to look into that

Thanks

If you find the above explanation adequate, would you consider this report resolved?

@sayaanalam - I will make an internal triage request.

>Hi, receiving the email is fine - the ticket is immediately deleted (it's a transaction process we cannot stop: so it DOES create the ticket, but then automation immediately resolves & deletes it, nobody ever gets to see it internally).
It's a bit of an odd behaviour, but a limitation of the 3rd party software we're using (maybe in combination with some of our config) it seems like

Agreed!!!
I don't see any confidential data, would you be willing to disclose?
Please redact screenshot and screen recording that contain my email address before disclosing.
My bad, done!
Good to disclose now!!!

summaries.content:
The reporter was able to submit support tickets via email as any user, similar to https://hackerone.com/reports/2068830 except via email.

>As of May 15, 2023, this email no longer accepts new requests. To contact us, please use our HackerOne Support Portal, https://support.hackerone.com/support/home.

but it would also create a ticket.

The hackers reporting #2068830, #2082680 caused us to take another look at this previously informative report (as it was a dupe, and then we realised it was actually different systems: email vs the actual support tool), so we chose to award both. 

We later discovered this was already mitigated internally - we already ensured it was resolved so nobody took a look at it, but now we also delete the ticket created. 

Something that's different from usual reports we get is that this was an asset not considered in scope, so we didn't have a concrete bounty table and it brought our team to the drawing board on how we want to handle such reports. Whilst we want to encourage hackers to hack on non-listed assets belonging to us, and also out-of-scope assets (i.e. for managed services) that are on us, such as misconfigurations or information disclosure.

Currently, it's not something we have clear guidelines for. We opted to give a bonus without bounty instead to speed the process along.

user.name: zerotea
user.bio: Hacker, Board Games enthousiast, mostly human and definitely not a robot. Software Engineer at HackerOne. They/them
